intro: Antirrhinum hispanicum subsp. africanum, commonly known as the African snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
